name: Sirdemo
tagline: A simple stereographic animation I created for a university project
body:
### What's here?
This is a demo program i put together in 2008 for a university exam on image generation and synthesis.
It uses OpenGL fragment shaders to generate a SIRD (Single-Image Random Dots) stereogram of a moving object on screen [SPOILER: It's a teapot, what were you expecting?]

### Why is it here?
Pretty much only to try the GitHub platform, since i don't plan to update the demo soon

### Authors and Contributors
I (@AlexNava) did the program and the shaders, there are no other contributions at the moment.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
